snippet: An Italian court accepted plea bargains in connection with the wreck of the Costa Concordia that killed 32 people.
abstract: Five employees of Italian cruise company Costa Crociere SpA are convicted of manslaughter in 2012 wreck of the Costa Concordia off Tuscany, which killed 32 people, receiving sentences of less than three years; lawyers for victims and survivors criticize penalties as too lenient.
lead_paragraph: An Italian court accepted plea bargains in connection with the wreck of the Costa Concordia that killed 32 people.
